notes: Final years of classic Saab 900 (1979-1993). Turbo engines, convertible variants. Front-wheel drive with longitudinal engine. Replaced by GM900 platform 1994. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 900 article, January 2025 revision.

Saab 9000 continued through 1998. Aero performance variant introduced. Type Four platform. Front-wheel drive executive car. Timing chain turbo engines. Strong North American sales. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9000 article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation Saab 900 (1994-1998). GM2900 platform shared with Opel Vectra. Controversial departure from classic 900. V6 option introduced. Front-wheel drive. Timing chain engines. Replaced by 9-3 in 1999. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 900 article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation Saab 9-3 launch years (1998-2002). Renamed 900 successor on GM2900 platform. Turbo engines standard. Front-wheel drive. Timing chain engines. Viggen high-performance variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9-3 article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation Saab 9-5 launch (1997-2010). GM2900 platform, 9000 replacement. Turbo engines standard, V6 turbo available. Front-wheel drive executive car. Timing chain engines. Aero performance variant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9-5 article, January 2025 revision.
